snippet: The Food and Drug Administration captured thousands of messages sent by disgruntled scientists to lawmakers, lawyers and even President Obama.
abstract: Investigation into the possible leaking of confidential Food and Drug Administration information by 5 agency scientists turned into a much broader campaign to counter outside critics of its medical review process turning up thousands of once confidential records; FDA officials defend the wide surveillance operation, saying that it focused only on the scientists suspected of leaking information about the safety and design of medical devices.

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and SCOTT SHANE

lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration captured thousands of messages sent by disgruntled scientists to lawmakers, lawyers and even President Obama.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Surveillance of Scientists Spread to Outside Critics
headline.main: Vast F.D.A. Effort Tracked E-Mails of Its Scientists
